instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2327: What is 820-2327? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Hardware Installed
threads.message:
WiFi card show: No Hardware Installed
Pin: 13 - 5v
Pin: 14 - 5v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Hardware Installed
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Hardware Installed
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Hardware Installed
threads.message: 90% of the time it is either a fucked up cable or connector. Inspect closer and try a known good assembly. 13 and 15 are both compatible for testing the airport connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Hardware Installed
threads.message: [USER="1"]larossmann[/USER] 0.2v in <SIGNAL>MINI_RESET_CONN</SIGNAL> and L3404 (<SIGNAL>PP5_WLAN</SIGNAL>) is burned. I just replaced, but still don't work.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Hardware Installed
threads.message: That burns when someone plugs the connector on the card inside the LCD the wrong way around. Did L3405 fry again?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Hardware Installed
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Hardware Installed
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Hardware Installed
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Hardware Installed
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Hardware Installed
threads.message: I told you why L3405 burned. So now this issue is probably a dead cable/connector or airport card. Start testing with a know good LCD and check if L3405 was not fried again by the old LCD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Hardware Installed
threads.message:
New cable and airport card.
The L3405 burnerd, bc the client plug the wrong way.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Hardware Installed
threads.message: No idea then, probably a bad connector. Measure all the pins to the airport card to confirm.
